review_body: I stayed here twice for a business trip.Stayed 7 nights on Jan and 4 nights on Feb.Besides the small rooms (Japan), service was great and breakfast as well.Oh~ they also serve free snacks and drinks during the day. Loved it.

I landed in Tokyo and decided to stay here for two nights since it’s close to Tokyo Station, where I was planning to take the bullet train out of. Well, it’s pretty close but still a good walk from where you alight the Narita Express at the station, and potentially confusing to get to as the station has many exits.The hotel itself was new-ish and the room was unsurprisingly small but big enough for one person and clean. There is a FamilyMart on the ground floor and many eateries nearby at Tokyo Square Garden. The Ginza shopping strip is also just a short walk away.I had breakfast both days and though there wasn’t a huge selection, the food was good and there was a slight variation between both days.

This hotel is in middle between Tokyo Station and Ginza. around 6 minutes walk to Ginza, so we did not pay the Ginza hotel price.The room is reasonable and modern.Internet also good and guest can enjoy complementary snack and coffee throughout the day.Definitely good value for money and will stay here again if in the area

We stayed at the start and the end of our trip to Japan and liked the fact only 10 minutes walk to Railway station. The location is good. Some of the staff were helpful and rang our next hotel to advice we would be arriving late.The rooms are, as we expected in Japan, very compact with little space for luggage and not easy for moving around with 2 people due to lack of space. The room was clean and well equipped.We arrived the first time about 12.00 and were charged 2,000 Yen for early check in. On our return we wanted to check in an hour early and were told it would be another 2,000 Yen on both occasions the room was ready. We declined to pay it a second time as most reputable hotels, across the world, allow early check in if the room is ready.The only other silly gripe we had was someone came to tell us not to eat our own food, a chocolate biscuit, in the lounge/public area! There were signs on the table however we took this to mean do not bring a meal with you.

Hotel is very well located, it's walking distance to the train station and subway which makes getting to all the prefectures super easy. It's also close to the high end shops in Ginza if that's your thing! Lovely staff and fabulous breakfast.

We stayed for a single night upon arrival in Tokyo. The hotel is in an excellent location near Tokyo Station. We were traveling with 70L backpacks and had no issues walking from Tokyo Station to the hotel in less than 15 minutes. The rooms are 'cozy' by North American standards but are spotless and offer numerous amenities including a full range of toiletries, complimentary bottled water and tea. If there is anything else you require there is a Family Mart located on the bottom floor. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. Although our stay was short, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to fellow travellers or to stay again myself.

We stayed overnight just to transit for another city. The hotel is efficient and extra super clean, even in the rooms where they allow us to smoke. A mini market is available downstairs. Their mix of Japanese and Western breakfast is the best during our 10-day tour in Japan, so delicious and plenty of choice, we stayed long for the breakfast. A bit of a walk for some blocks if you come from / want to go to the Tokyo station. Overall, top rating for this hotel.

Great location in Tokyo for getting around with Tokyo Station and subway stops nearby. Staff were very friendly, breakfast was good with a mix of asian and western food.The room was very small but we only needed it to rest at night so was sufficient for us.

I liked our stay here, it is very close to Tokyo Station 7/8 min walk or so and there is a subway stop literally right outside the hotel as well. This hotel is very good if you want to take day trips from Tokyo Station, which we did a lot and also good for exploring the city as well, which we did too. The area itself is not that lively but it's within walking distance of the popular Ginza area. The staff was friendly and provided a easy check in and check out. Only negative is the rooms are just small, I had to rearrange a table on top of another just to be able to open both our suitcases on the floor without tripping over anything, but I suppose that is all of Tokyo hotels : )
user_name:
XavierNY
New York City, New York

review_body: We walked to the hotel from Yaesu exit of Tokyo Station for about 15 minutes. The receptionist is very polite with fluent English. Check in is prompt with adequate information.The room is small as this is usual in Tokyo but it is spotless and comfortable. Complementary all day coffee, drinks, snacks and soup rice after 9:00pm is a bonus.A 24 hr convenient shop is also at the hotel entrance. The location is at a walkable distance to Ginza as well as Tsukiji Market . There are many restaurants nearby especially in the underground shopping center.The location is quiet but convenient.

Very satisfied with well located (Ginza, close to the central station), quiet, fresh, clean, comfortable and stylish hotel. It offers a rich, well cooked and served breakfast. The staff is very friendly.

Really good hotel and pretty new!!!! Close from the metro and the train station! I really enjoyed my stay at this hôtel! Good quality for the price!! The service was also really nice!!!I highly recommand it!

Whenever I returned back to the city I once traveled, I would usually stay in different hotels for the experience. And I never regretted staying with Hotel Intergate Tokyo Kyobashi for several reasons:1. Had my luggage arranged to be delivered to the hotel prior my stay. Hotel received and stored my luggage until my check-in. The hotel staff even anticipated my needs and took my luggage out of storage without me having to tell them!2. Room is very clean and slightly bigger than other local-chained hotels that I have stayed before. The room has space for a small coffee table and two cushioned stools by the window for me and my partner to sit and enjoy a cup of tea.3. Complimentary (free flow) hot coffee, tea, ice water and juices at the lounge area for in-house guests.4. 24 hour convenience store available right below the hotel. You can enter in and out from within the building without having to get out of the hotel.5. Hotel is located less than 1 min walk to Kyobashi Station Exit 1 (Tokyo Metro Ginza Line) and Takaracho Station Exit A4 (Toei Asakusa Subway Line). 6. Convenient to get to Haneda Airport as the Toei Asakusa Subway Line offers direct train service from Takaracho Station.7. During the recent typhoon weekend, I had witnessed the hotel being accommodating to allow their guests to check-in earlier at 1.00pm instead of the usual 3.00pm, whereas some hotels are still very rigid with the rules.I would strongly recommend to those who are considering this property!

I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Intergate - check in after 3pm is'nt great (albeit the norm it would seem in Japan). Our room was small but perfectly fine for what we needed. Good location also. The reception team arranged for our bag to be sent to the next Tokyo hotel after our week on travelling - worked perfectly! Thanks

Myself and 2 female frineds drive a rental car and checked in 2 rooms late night at around 2350hrs due to typhoon blocked lots of highways, traffic jam for 6 hours. Spent like the whole afternoon driving from Fuji no the 4 luggage and a few bags at all, only show the way to the lift for check in while I have to park the car.My female friend told me afterward that when they exit the lift in the reception floor and the receptionist (maybe the manager)later known as Mr. Hanada just hind inside the counter after a short eye contact. The whole check in process without smile, the amount we have to pay waIn the mean time, Hanada point at one of my friend and talked in Japanese which we feel embarrassed. The hardware of the hotel is nice, room is small but normal in Tokyo, bright enough with technology stuffs equipped.In general, as a hotel manager myself this is not acceptable and could have hugh improvement. I stay because of those good comments just show on a calculater without further expenation which is not the same with our confirmation. I saw online, maybe day time staff are nice just the overnight staff feels like they resigned and don't give a xxxx

This hotel was very clean and close to Tokyo station- perfect for a quick stopover. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Comfortable bed and the room was small but useable. Would recommend for a stay in Ginza.

the property has very nice interior at the lobby which all guests can relax in the morning with breakfast and the afternoon with happy hours. the hotel room is in good condition with the regular size in Japanese Styles. the location is good within the short distance to Tokyo Station and Post Office where is a big center to sightseeing as the local shop.
user_name:
WTNYC80
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was just 1 min walk from exit of the Asakusa line and also 3 to 4 minutes walk from Ginza line and 10 min and 15 min walk from Tokyo station and Ginza station.Convenience coming from Haneda airport as well as going to shibuya, Harajuku,shinjuku area for 20 to 30 min by train.Effordable price.

I travel everywhere solo and this hotel provides the best in terms of coziness. The room was small but I had a double bed which was just perfect for me only. The hotel is about a 15min walk to the Tokyo Station and Ginza area. There is a family Mart at the ground floor and perfection after a long day of sightseeing to finish off with some sake and mini snacks!

The room was small but I assume that all the rooms are this size as it is Tokyo. Seemed like mostly business people.The room was clean and modern. The bathroom was a good size and had a lot of amenities. The price included breakfast which was quite diverse and good. The location was okay not too far from the Ginza.

This hotel might have gotten 5 stars if they had been generous in offering a much-needed hour of late check-out time. We came in exhausted after our international flight, so no happy hour, cookies, etc wanted. We needed extra time in the morning, which they smilingly offered at $20, so, no. Their right to charge but very disappointing. The good:Spent the extra for a corner twin and well worth it for the space. Quite a bit of the space is wasted in this room with essentially two entry areas...but room to spread your luggage about. Windows on 2 walls really make it feel open.Lots of outlets at the bed. Super comfy mattress. Larger towels than many hotels in this category. All amenities provided. Very very quiet.Breakfast was a small affair, but plenty of proteins from eggs to little sausages. Coffee was good. Delicious fresh fruit. The best thing about this hotel, which I was unclear on when I booked, is that it is a non-stop train from Haneda Airpot to Takaracho Station on the Keikyu Line. This takes you 20 feet from their entrance. The hotel would do well to make this clear to visitors. It's a HUGE advantage!(we discovered thru a Google nav search...had first planned to come in to Tokyo Station, which is a 10-15 min walk. ...With the extra business generated, perhaps they could afford to gift an extra hour to future weary travellers.

The Intergate is a great hotel in the middle of Tokyo, close to the Imperial Palace and just10 minutes' walk from the Tokyo station and even much closer to the Kyobashi subway station. The neighborhood is stylish and pleasant with lots of restaurants, cafes and other entertainment. The more traditional restaurants of Yurakucho are also a short walk away.The hotel itself is very neat. The rooms are small, as they are in the smaller hotels in Tokyo, but they are functional, comfortable and bright (I can imagine, though, it being a challenge if you were to have lots of luggage). One of the nicest aspects, however, is the common area adjacent to the lobby where there is always coffee available, as well as nice teatime snacks, and a happy hour with complimentary wine to guests every late afternoon. The space is very comfortable, simply and elegantly decorated. It's also a good place to read or work a bit or meet people.And there is a convenience store downstairs with direct access from the hotel should you need to buy anything.All in all, a very nice hotel.
user_name:
JuhaUitto
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were originally allocated a tiny room with a tiny bed on with walls on 3 sides which we asked to have changed to a bigger room. The room they then gave us a marginally bigger room, but still not that comfortable. They then charged us a further JPY 107,720 on top of the original room charge without even telling us there would be an additional charge. THAT'S A $1,000 CHANGE FEE TO CHANGE OUR ROOM TO A SLIGHTLY BIGGER ONE FOR 4 NIGHTS.Couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Rooms are tiny. Breakfast options are limited and the chance of being ripped off plentiful.

The Intergate was very close to Tokyo Station and the Imperial Palace area. The room was larger than I expected, and it was offered some extra amenities like free drinks in the reception area. I was very happy.

Got the moderate room and stayed for 3 nights. Hotel was clean and looks new. As per all other Tokyo hotels, it is small. We got a weird layout and wasn’t able to fully utilise the space. But was cosy enough. Good for those who only need a place to sleep.Great service and check out was super easy. Did the express check out on our TV and left the key by the keycard holder.We tried their free coffee (available all day except during breakfast). There is a family mart right below and we bought our breakfast there.Convenient and near to two stations. Good enough to travel around Tokyo. And a good 10 mins walk to Ginza.Highly recommend :)

I stayed 4days here and I never felt any negative feeling.very clean, close to subway station and Tokyo station, good service..There are Japanese convenience store in first floor so whenever you can get anything you want without going outside.I wanna stay here again when I go back to Tokyo as tourist.
user_name:
Global623462
New York City, New York

review_body: Convenient location (close to 3 subway stations). I had chosen it to be close to Tokyo Station because I was arriving on NX and departing via Shinkansen, but turned out the location was a longer than expected walk (with luggage) to JR Tokyo Station but actually better suited for exploring Tokyo via subway. Walking distance to Imperial Palace for nice morning walks, to Ginza and other fun neighborhoods. If you are wanting to explore the east side of Tokyo, this is a solid business hotel. There is a Family Mart downstairs. 2nd floor has check in and breakfast area. I did not opt for breakfast because there are options close by. It is a business hotel in a business district, so not a lot of shopping immediately close by. There are restaurants close by but the street is a main auto boulevard. Staff was professional and helpful.

We needed to stay near Tokyo station to get an early morning Shinkansen, and the Intergate was a fantastic choice. The hotel was only a 10 minute easy walk from the station, and we arrived to a seemingly new hotel that was modern and very comfortable.Our room on the 16th was the usual Japanese size, not overly spacious, but manageable. The decor was very modern and functional and everything was spotlessly clean. WiFi worked well in the room and there was an English language channel on the TV for news.We were pleasantly surprised to see the free snacks and coffee in the lounge throughout the day. Happy hour from 5-7pm was also good, with some lovely Italian wines available free of charge.The Ginza district was only around the corner, a 5 minute walk to the the famous shopping street. There was a Family Mart convenience store on the ground floor for snacks, drinks and essentials.This was a great stay and we’d certainly recommend it!

My husband and I stayed here our first night in Tokyo since it was easy to get to from the airport (via Tokyo Station). It was modern and well-kept and we appreciated the free soup in the evening. The honey bar was cute, though not filling. The room was quite small, but that wasn't a problem for us and it was easy for us to do a small amount of sightseeing from there. It was nice and relaxing. I think my husband would like to stay here again - there were no low lintels to hit his head on like he did in most ryokans!

Excellent hotel in very convenient location. Tokyo Station is 15 minutes by foot, two subway lines are basically in front of hotel and both Ginza and Nihonbashi quarters are within easy walking distance. Room was small but functional and spotlessly clean. Staff is very helpful and professional. Breakfast is excellent with lots of cooked options even for vegetarians and they also bake their own bread. Plus, during the day they have complimentary coffee, tea and juices available in the lobby and even sweets in the afternoon. We were so satisfied that we booked it again for the end of our Japan trip.

We stayed here for a single night. Had a wonderful stay. We got the standard double. The bed was quite sufficient for my wife and I. We booked with breakfast. The breakfast was just delightful - many western and Japanese options.The room was very clean and provided every amenity possible - ethernet cable (for the business minded), hair dryer, multi-phone charger (USB C, Lightning, Micro USB, etc), toothbrust, razor, hairbrush, electric water boiler. The bathroom is more spacious than a normal Japan bathroom. Is the room small? Sure, but not the smallest we have encountered. We had enough space to lay out our standard luggage. Very high quality room. WiFi was excellent.The hotel goes the extra mile for guests in the common areas. Every day they have available free coffee and tea, a honey buffet (which is 4 types of honey to try with bread) during late afternoon hours, wine and crackers before dinner hours, and late night rice porridge snack for those still hungry. Their reception is very friendly, very attentive.Location is excellent too. It is a 10 minute walk from Tokyo station, only a 15 minute walk to Tsukiji fish market, a short walk to Ginza, and right next to several metro lines. Best of all is that the price won't break the bank. Very affordable for near 5-star quality (in my opinion).Will stay here again in the fuure.

Almost wanted to keep this excellent hotel just to myself! It’s the best hotel in Japan I’ve stayed so far and it is super value for money.Hotel allows all guests to access the lobby lounge equal to an executive floor lounge. Drinks and snacks are served throughout the day for free (except breakfast), and I am talking decent snacks. Location was excellent, literally 2 min walk to two different subway exits! I will definitely stay here if I’m in Tokyo again.

What a find! Though the rooms are quite small, everything is clean and comfortable. The location can't be beat for getting to/from Tokyo Station where you can find anything on your shopping and eating list. Also a very short stroll into the Ginza area with more shopping and eating :-) Would have preferred a room with a window that can be opened but maybe that option is available in certain rooms. For the price and location Hotel Intergate can't be beat and I would definitely return.

Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during my business trip in Tokyo. Nothing to complain about, great location, clean room, friendly staff, delicious breakfast, walking distance to the famous Ginza street, but if they can provide a laundry bag it'll be nicer. Other than that, it's a perfect hotel.

I stayed for two days during Easter’s holiday for sightseeing in Tokyo area. I enjoyed my stay very much due to its convenient location next to a couple subway stations, friendly staff and a variety of free snacks and drinks during different hours of the day. The room was clean and the hotel itself was quite well maintained. Highly recommended especially if you are on business trip to Ginza area!

The Intergate is literaaly a stones throw from Tokyo Station and the shopping district of Ginza. All walking distance. If you should want to wander to other locations in Tokyo, as of course you will, you subway station will be only 50 metres from the hotel. So location is great. The hotel is well organized and you are furnished with toothbrushes and paste, combs, brushes, coffee and tea as well as pyjamas. The rooms clean albeit rather small. But remember you are paying a medium price for a room in Central Tokyo.When I go back to Tokyo I will certainly book there again.

Stayed here at the beginning and end of my trip to Tokyo. Very easy access from both Narita and Haneda airports. There is a convenience store attached to hotel. Very clean and new. Enjoyed the free happy hour and morning coffee. Great buffet breakfast too. Very friendly, English-speaking staff.

Located 1 minute from Kyobashi station ( Ginza line ) and 1 minute from Takaracho station ( Asakusa line ) with direct access to Haneda by train. Check in was easy. Room was small but very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent with selection of Western and Japanese and good coffee. Bubbly at breakfast on weekends. Honey tasting in the afternoon and happy hour in the evening a nice touch. Plenty of convenience stores nearby.Staff helpful with a smile. Would definitely stay here again.

I don’t have much to add to the other reviews listed for this property, but I agree that I would certainly stay again. There is a pretty good Indian restaurant nearby if you need a break from Japanese, The Ginza line (literally 2 minutes from hotel door) turned out to be very handy for a tourist like myself chasing the sites. If new to Tokyo, there is a downloadable subway app that will optimize your route for you—-real timesaver. Oh, and the elevator can be a bit slow—-especially during normal check in and check out times. But otherwise, was a great stay.

Excellent one night stay. Stayed in a single non-smoking unit. Very Clean and Compact room, well designed and thought out. Had a window that opened, a fridge, safe, bottled water and good wifi. Staff very friendly, easy check in/out. Convenience store next door and hotel sits between two subway stations, Takaracho & Kyobashi. Will stay again.

The hotel is located 10 minutes from Ginza’s high end retailers and 10 minutes from Tokyo Station which provides links to all of Japan. Check in was quick and painless a complementary cosmetic set with bath salts and creams was provided by the receptionist. The room was spotless, the cleanest one we have stayed in Tokyo. Complementary tea, coffee and biscuits are provided at certain times of the day on the first floor and complementary wine is also provided at set times all excellent. There is a Tube station next to the hotel which provides a service to Haneda airport with no need to change trains very handy ideal if you are leaving Japan. The hotel is an excellent alternative to booking a hotel near the airport.

Our party of three stayed here for 6 nights on a sightseeing trip, the reasonable rates and availability of single twin rooms were the deciding factor. Upon arrival we discovered how easy the subway access was which made it easy to zip all over the city on the subway. The hotel was spotless, rooms were clean and well appointed. The breakfast buffet was awesome with an amazing selection of local and western foods. Coffee was outstanding. Wifi worked great and appreciated the mini frig in the rooms as there was a convenience store on the ground floor to buy beverages. Nice common area to hang out in but you could not bring in outside drinks/food. Highly recommend, there was a mix of business and tourist travelers.

Its hard to review hotels in Japan - because, like with so many things in Japan, everything just works perfectly and people are wonderfully helpfull and professional. This hotel is no exception. We chose here as it's easily walkable from the main JR Tokyo station (10 in walk ~ish) and next to a Ginza line metro station. A combination of the location and a reasonable rate made this a sensible choice for 4 nights in Tokyo.The staff were, without exception professional and helpfull and check in was a pleasure. The room was compact, but as we have toured Japan previously and become used to tiny rooms this room was relatively spacious. As usual everything worked - excellent wifi - comfy bed and super shower.We didn't choose the breakfast option - but particularly welcome was the free coffee / wine / biscuits / cake buffet laid on of an early evening.... very hospitable. We spent a very pleasant 4 nights here and were sorry to leave. We are the kind of people who get up and head out to experience the city and get back late but nonetheless we enjoyed our time in this hotel and felt at very much at home. If you are looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable rate to take advantage of good transport links then you will not go far wrong here.

We loved this place, stayed somewhere else with our time in Japan too and wished we were back here even if it was a bit more expensive then our other place, this is 'large' compared to other rooms in Japan. Nice rooms, new stuff, great bath tub, comfortable but firm bed. Good location close to Ginza, walking distance or right on several train lines. We will stay here for sure again! A conviencance store right underneath open 24hrs. Restaurants aren't right downstairs have to walk 5-15min to get to some good ones. All in all, perfect for Tokyo!

The room was clean and comfortable. The extra amenities available, such as the portable Handy with complimentary internet was great for accessing maps whilst we were exploring Tokyo. Also appreciated the complimentary tea/coffee and evening snacks available in the lobby. Great service and value for money.

I stayed here for 2 nights and booked the single room - it’s small but very good value for money. Comfortable bed and well-equipped (hair dryer, safe, water boiler, bathroom amenities...). The location is perfect, I walked to the park and took the metro a lot as the Ginza line is just 3 minutes from the hotel. I didn’t use it, but they also offer free snacks and drinks. Staff is very friendly (as anywhere in Tokyo).

We booked this hotel in advance of arriving in Japan. Good choice! It’s about 6 mins. away from the rail station where we are using our very expensive JR rail pass. The hotel is not large nor is our room but centrally located, clean, modern and comfortable. It’s even got a handy cell phone for guests to use - had we known this, we would have picked up our wifi router later on in our trip. They even had hotel PJs for us! However, the elevators are small and we are staying on the 13th floor!

Sadly we only had one night here on our final day before returning home. I had intended to stay here for three nights on our arrival in Tokyo but unfortunately it was fully booked. It was a really nice hotel. The rooms were small (fairly typical in Japan) but clean and fresh and well appointed with everything you might need. The hotel is about ten minutes walk from Tokyo main train station (with it's huge underground shopping mall and food court) and with two subway stops minutes away. The reception is situation on the second floor with a large seating area and where breakfast is served (there is a family mart on the ground floor). The night we stayed various "free" (i.e. included in the price) buffets were laid on. Between about 5.00 and 7.00 p.m. there were nibbles, yogourt, fruit and tea and coffee. This was followed by wine and cocktails with rice and various accompaniments laid on later in the evening. It really was lovely to relax on the second floor area in between heading out for a few hours of last minute shopping. The breakfast buffet in the morning was also splendid. If I return to Tokyo again this will be the frirst hotel I check for availability. It provided a really lovely end to our Japan holiday.

3 star hotel with 5 star services and amenities. Hotel super new and clean, albeit rooms are small but manageable for two pax. Not complaining the size of the room as it's only 5 mins away from Ginza shopping belt and 20mins walk from nearest Don Quijote, Ginza.It's the sweet little touches that will make me want to book this hotel again.We get pyjamas, room air freshener, feminine gift bag (face cream/facial wash etc), scented bath salt, phone cables etc. All these add-ons made the experience really awesome!

Perfectly located next to the Kyobashi metro station and not far from Ginza - as well as being next to Tokyo station. It is the perfect location for spending time in Tokyo! The rooms are typical mini rooms but so well appointed, modern and comfortable with a lush deep bath! They really got this place right! A convenience store on the street level also made it ideal. Highly recommend for a comfortable and efficient Tokyo stay!

We stayed for two nights and it was a great location close to the imperial palace and Tokyo Station which connects to everywhere. Room was small but we were only there to sleep. Very tidy and great buffet breakfast!

Since I was arriving late into Tokyo I selected this hotel primarily since it was within steps of the Takaracho subway stop. Also adding to the convenience was a Family Mart located in the same building on the ground floor. On the 2nd floor was the main lobby and breakfast/coffee bar/snack area. I liked the openess, layout and decor that gave it an inviting feeling. At different times of the day I would find people hanging out at the tables eating, drinking or just socializing.When I entered my room, it mirrored the lobby with clean lines and modern look. The layout resulted in a wider than expected aisle between the bed/bath and the desk/opposite wall. I liked having this feeling of extra room but the trade off was not much storage or a closet (just a rack and a couple of clothes hangars). This was the first hotel that included a set of pajamas!The bathroom was tight but came with all the standard amenities (shaver, toothbrush, shampoo and soap). The toilet was a fully automatic Toto with a heated seat.The bed was quite comfortable and I did not hear much noise eventhough my room faced the street.Checkout was 11AM but they will hold on to your luggage if you still need to explore Tokyo.

Loved how clean, streamlined (room/hotel design), and conveniently located this hotel was during our visit. However, our check-in experience and general unwelcome vibe colored our stay. Due to our long international flights and train arrival, we picked up some bentos on our way to the hotel, thinking we could eat and rest before leaving our stuff to go sightseeing until the 3pm check-in time. Nope! Staff seemed alarmed that we'd eat our off-site food there and told us that we had to eat elsewhere. We were so jet lagged and unfamiliar with the area, and had to ask a couple of times where we could eat. Finally, it was suggested that we walk along the street and find some public benches!After that, we didn't know where/when we could hang out and plan like we'd typically do at other hotels. We couldn't tell what was truly a public area for guests to relax vs. the official boundaries of the restaurant/dining area. The rooms are small per the usual, so gathering in someone's room was not a good option either. Regardless, this is a nice hotel but with so many other options in that area, I might investigate other properties to find one that fits all our needs and comfort.

Very good location. There are several metro stations within 5-10 min walk and is about 10 -12 min walk to Tokyo station. There is a convience store next to the group entrance of the hotel. The room is comfortable and spacious (in Tokyo's standard). There are free coffee and smoothie from 6-7am, and free late night snacks from 9-11pm. It even provides a free smartphone during your stay. I used it for GPS navigation and google when I go out since I didn't rent a WiFi router from Narita airport.

This place is perfectly located on the Ginza line and about 10 min walk from central station. It is in a business district so not much culture. Here is what I loved:Pajamasfree happy hour winegreat warm welcome50m from metro stoponly dislike is that the rooms are small. but I would come back here in a minute

Very close to Tokyo station. We stayed here because it's a 10 minute walk from Tokyo station, where we arrived by Shinkansen from Kyoto. Also a 1 minute walk from the subway line to Haneda airport. Location is great, the room is small, but the bathroom and bed were very clean and new. The lobby offers free coffee and wine and snacks during the day.

Great location, 2 train stations (Kyobashi and Takaracho) right at the door. Very clean hotel, friendly staff, service with a smile. Tasty healthy breakfast, a blend of western and local styles with plenty of dishes. We are vegetarians and had very good breakfast during our 8 night stay. Coffee, juice, cake etc whole day, free drinks, rice and soup after 9 pm included. You don't need a phone with roaming or data; every room has a smart phone free to use in Tokyo to navigate, also you can call overseas free of cost! Clean rooms, small but OK, beds comfortable. Convenience store on the ground floor is very very convenient. You can reach the Hotel from Narita Airport by train or bus, however, bus is very convenient. Just get down from bus at Tokyo station or Ginza terminals and walk for 6-9 minutes or hire a taxi by waving on the road (no need to go to taxi stand), which will drop you to the hotel in less than 5 minutes and will charge around 600 to 900 Yen. There is some direct trains from Narita to Takaracho station, but you have to climb 20 stairs at the Takaracho station.The hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from Tokyo Station and the pickup hotels for day tours. Many restaurants in the area and top Ginza shops are within walking distance.I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely stay again at this hotel on my next trip to Tokyo.

We stayed here for 6 nights and had such a comfortable stay. The regular rooms are small though so it was rather cramp for 2 adults and 1 toddler. But everything else compensated for it. The location was excellent, very close to 2 subway station. Taking a train from Narita airport and taking a train to Haneda airport was very convenient. The subway stations has a lift. A family downstairs. Lots of restaurants around the corner. 8 mins walk to Tokyo station where we took a bullet train to Hakone. The neighbourhood is rather quiet at night, and in the day it was an office crowd, so the pavements are not busy which is great when you're travelling in a group of 6 + 1 toddler in a stroller. We had breakfast for 6 mornings and the breakfast is so good. The breakfast food was more or less the same daily but the food is so tasty you don't get bored of it, and there was a wide selection. I kept going back to my favourite dishes. They provide ladies with toiletries pack which was moisturiser, cleanser, cotton wool , cotton sponge, we were also given bath bombs for each night of our stay and my toddler with his toddler toiletry pack which was a cute little toothbrush, a sponge and slippers. The bathroom is big enough to move around in and i love their deep bath tub and water pressure. The rooms are super quiet despite being next to a major road. I think it's more of a business hotel due to the location but as a family, we didn't feel uncomfortable. And despite the hotel being fully booked, it was really quiet on the hotel room floor. I'm afraid my room was probably the noisiest due to my child playing.

One of the best hotel with top-notch facilities. Located in between subway station and 8 minutes walk to Tokyo Station.The room is just nice for a solo traveler, clean and comfortable. The bed is good, the shower amenities are excellent and classy.They provide a lot of free food. Free smoothies in the morning, honey and croissants in the afternoon, coffee and wine in the late afternoon, and free rice with soup at night. Very good for the value you pay.

Stay here for 3 nights. Location is great, Takaracho subway is just outside of the hotel. Tokyo station is about 5 mins walk and 7-10 mins walk to Ginza. There is a convenient store on hotel ground floor. Room is Japan standard size. Clean and bright , cozy. Definitely a great stay for business or couples. And there is a free wine and drink and small snacks in the evening. It’s very good gesture from hotel. Price is affordable. Definitely will stay here again.

Stayed at tis hotel for 4 nts tis past Sept while vacationing in Tokyo. Tis hotel is in Ginza district. No complaints. Hotel close to subways. Awesome buffet selection! Love the crossaints and the ponzu butter. They hav trasitonal Japanese as well as western buffet. Will stay here again.

I had the pleasure to stay for four nights at Intergate, I would however recommend to maybe stay a fewer number of nights as the rooms are very small, in my opinion even smaller than average Japanese hotels. The lack of a proper a wardrobe is annoying for me, and the bathroom module is crammed to fit all the necessary parts (toilet, bathtub, sink etc). Intergate is located conveniently close to Tokyo station and is easily accessed by foot from both subway lines. The lobby is on the second floor and shared with the breakfast restaurant. The breakfast is amazing, with a large selection of dishes, both western and eastern style. A special treat is the “free” after work bar that the hotel complimentary keeps open in the afternoons serving wine and other beverages. Kind and helpful staff will be able to help your stay being as comfortable as possible. As always the hotel is spotlessly clean and no disturbing noise disturbs your sleep as the neighbourhood is calm and quiet. I will come back to stay

Although still small this was the largest room of our trip, with a very long comfortable bed. Around the corner from Tokyo station -very convenient- and from Ginza - a very little walk away. Complimentary drinks and nibbles every evening in lounge area between 5-7pm - except for beer which had to be paid for! Breakfast was delicious with a very comprehensive offering of food.

We stayed here for our Tokyo trip. It's easy to get to from Haneda airport. And from the hotel we walked to Ginza, the fish market (which is now relocated) and Tokyo Station. Very convient location! Rooms are clean and decent size (if you're used to HK size these are bigger). Staff was friendly. Can recommend if you're staying in Tokyo

I have been in Hotel Intergate Tokyo for three nights. The hotel is very well located ten minutes walking distance from the Central Tokyo Train Station. The area is surrounded of plenty of restaurants and shopping malls, close to Ginza main road. Also there is a subway station one minute away. It’s a new hotel, the room is clean and bigger size of Japanese’ standards. Equipped with everything you need and a complimentary smart phone to be connected all time. The breakfast buffet is very good, Japanese and West style. Also there is a FamilyMart on the ground floor. Suitable for couples, families and solo travellers. Al staff are very professional and helpful. Rated as a good-very good.

Location of hotel was bery good You can walk to the Ginza street and Tokyo station for shopping Also you can use honey buffet for free!! Everyone in this hotel was kind.. It was so wonderful time in Japan위치 좋고 직원들도 엄청 친절함 가격대비 시설이 새 것이라 매우 훌륭했으며 리셉션 근처 로비에서 꿀 뷔페 즐길 수 있음위치도 긴자와 매우 가까워 걸어갈 수 있음클렌징 폼 오일 등 어메니티 일체 제공과 입욕제도 제공 다음에 또 머물고 싶음

I absolutely loved my stay at this hotel. It was perfectly located (5 mins to Ginza, 10mins to Tokyo station), super reasonably priced and ultra modern. Rooms are small but so are all Tokyo hotels. This is made up for by them being excellently thought through and stocked with great quality furnishings and extras. I couldn’t think of a hotel that better balances value for money and amenities. Very highly recommended.

Stayed 3 nights in a double room. Rooms are small similar to other hotel rooms in Tokyo. But the room was very clean and cosy. Comfortable bed and 2 choices of pillows. Breakfast was good and they have a whole day snack selection served after breakfast at 10:30. It's nice to come back after a whole day out to some coffee and light snacks just to unwind. Will definitely stay again!

Location: Relatively short walk from main Tokyo train station. Manageable even with luggage. Convenient if you want to use Tokyo as a base for day trips by train with Japan Rail Pass. The hotel is also right at the doorstep of two metro stations which will take you to key areas in the city like Shibuya, Harajuku, Asakusa or Akihabara. Ginza is a short walk away. Breakfast: Decent for a three star hotel. If you miss the breakfast or don't want to take it at the hotel or if you are after non-Japanese food there is a Starbucks and Subway close to the hotel. There also is a 24hr convenience store at the ground floor of the hotel builidng. Rooms: Small but comfortable and ultra clean. The size is standard for Japanese hotels. Lots of free toiletries in the bathroom including razors, combs and toothbrushes. Cannot complain. I am surprised how they fit multiple furniture and appliances into such a small space. I had a room on a high floor and there was no street noise even with an open window. Overall: This hotel is good value for money.

I was worried about the air con since it was summer season but as it turned out, it was adequate. It was a wall mounted individual unit and pointed directly at the bed so that kept me comfortable while sleeping. Other part of the room was warm.As for breakfast, it had mixed of Japanese and western. Scrambled eggs were pretty good. By that I mean it was not dry. Oh on Sunday there was sparkling wine.. Coffee was a bit weak for me.

I was very satisfied with my four night stay at the Intergate Kyobashi. The hotel is extremely new and everything is in excellent condition. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and relaxation/dining area in a stylish Japanese modern design. There is even a selection of books about Japan and Tokyo to browse over a free coffee. Staff are extremely friendly, helpful and attentive. Better service frankly than some European luxury hotels that I've stayed in. The room was very small, as is the reality in Tokyo apart from the top end, but very cleverly designed to be highly comfortable and functional. All kinds of thoughtful conveniences are provided, from charger adaptors to room freshening spray. Wifi quality was excellent. A convenience store is available on the ground floor with pretty much anything you could want in terms of drinks and snacks. Be aware that some rooms face a blank wall, so take care in booking if that is not your preference. Location is on a somewhat quiet business street but there is a Metro stop next door (Asakusa line) and Tokyo station (with its excellent underground shopping mall) and the Imperial Palace district are but a relatively short walk, as is Tsukiji market and central Ginza.I would highly recommend this hotel as a good value for money base to explore Tokyo and I would certainly stay there again in the future. Please keep up the high standard Intergate team!

This small but very new hotel provided a lot of little extras that made my 6 night stay a real delight! A wide selection in their breakfast buffet, free specialty coffee all day till 9 pm, complimentary snacks at 3 pm, free (and unlimited) happy hour drinks of red and white wine from 5 pm to 7 pm, and a midnight snack from 9 pm onwards. Internet connection was fast. The rooms were clean and modern, bathroom included a bath tub and was slightly bigger than most other hotels of their class that I’ve stayed at in Japan. Not quite in Ginza and not quite in Nihonbashi, but a comfortable walk to both. Subway stop right by the front door, and a convenience store on the ground floor, all made it a great place to stay. Staff was very friendly and hospitable (although they seemed to work longer hours than might be healthy—- the same staff that we saw in the night shift were there to greet us when we came down for breakfast!). Special kudos to Mr. Oota, who was especially gracious and helpful to us. My only complaints: wish the staff could speak better English, wish there were Western channels (like CNN!) on tv, and wish the air conditioning in our room stayed consistently cool (Tokyo was really HOT during the week that I was there). Other than that, great stay! I’d book this hotel again in a flash next time I come to Tokyo.

The location of the hotel is a bit far outside of the city center of Tokyo. At least the drive to the airport is only about 30 minutes.The hotel itself makes a strange impression already because of the entrance. Not easy to find. We almost passed it. There is not so many things around. Some bars which close early. All restaurants and bars need a long distance to walk.The hotel itself has small rooms like usual in Japan. Behind the window there was directly a wall, so there is no look outside. The room was clean and the bathroom really small. In general the hotel was not so clean.The hotel staff so far was friendly, but we had a lot of trouble during check in, because they try to do a digital check in at an automat, which doesn't properly work. First refuse the credit card several times until we need to go to the front desk and even they had problems to register and charge the credit card. Not professional system and it does not even work and makes you more crazy than happy to stay in this hotel.All in all a hotel which is not really recommendable for a trip to Tokyo. Problems during check in, hotel staff does not know what to do, rooms are tiny and not so clean. The breakfast starts at 7 am which was too late for us, because we had to leave before. So we couldn't test the breakfast. They didn't even offer the service to open half an hour earlier for guests who need to leave earlier.Not really recommendable.

Pretty new hotel and near the Tokyo train station. Convenient if you travel around from Tokyo station. Clean, good services and good value for price paid. A 24-hour convenient store is right at the exit of the hotel. Room size is considered as ok for non-high end hotels in Japan.

Stayed 3 nights at this hotel! The hotel is pretty new! Loved their room designs and facilities. It's walkable to Tokyo station (go for the Yaesu central exit at Tokyo station) and towards a mcdonalds at the end of the hallway. It's also walkable to Ginza area too!!! such a good location. There is a family mart connected to the hotel. Amenities are all there. Hotel staff knows English and are helpful and kind. However, the AC in my room was noisy over the nights. I wasn't sure if it's just my room or what, but the rest of the hotel is good and I would stay here again.

I stayed at the Intergate for one night after arriving in Tokyo by train in the afternoon. I chose the hotel because it was less than a 15 minute walk from the Tokyo station. The hotel is modern and appears to be very new. Everything is clean and well taken care of. The room, while small and on the top floor was well appointed and very clean. The bed was very comfortable.The check in is a bit odd in that you check in and then go to a machine to pay. But, it works. Checkout is done at the same machine.The hotel staff were friendly and courteous. The lounge area has free snacks and drinks for most of the day, excluding breakfast times.Overall, this is a very good option if you are looking for a hotel in Tokyo near the Tokyo Station.

Centric, 10 mins walk from yaesu exit Tokyo station. 1 min walk from kyobashi and takaracho stations. The hotel is new and everything was so perfect, clean, good service, superb amenities and comfy beds. Recommended for staying in ginza

The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and had complimentary WiFi. Unfortunately, and I guess nothing one can expect in this part of the city (next to Kyobashi Station), the only window in the room was facing the wall of the building next door (3m distance). The room was quite narrow and small so that I had to squeeze myself through the open suitcase and the wall in order to get to the bed. Big plus is definitely the complimentary food and beverage offer at the reception almost throughout the whole day. Unfortunately, I haven't come around to give it a try so that I cannot comment on the quality of this offer.

I’m very impressed. Great location, large room and the price is very reasonable. Only one thing to be aware is that the hotel staffs do not help guests make restaurant reservations. If you are like me that you cannot speak Japanese, good luck.

We stayed in this brand new hotel, which opened on April 1st for three day. The room was small with a double bed, typical of Japanese standard. Location is what makes it work close to Kyobashi or Takaracho stations and Ginza strip. The hotel provided a cell phone for during our stay which was very helpful, The complimentary evening ochazuke was a nice touch. Staff had some challenges with English but we managed to communicate well in spite of it.

This hotel was opened in April 2018 and we stayed 3 nights here. The rooms are small but amazing, you have everything you need in there. Was better then other 4 stars hotels that I stayed in Japan and the location is also good, close to train stations and metro.

The hotel is between Tokyo station and Yurakucho station. You have to know the area in order to find it easily. Hotel just opened up. Things look new, but don't expect any luxury feeling. It's just a basic hotel. And the staff's english needs to improve.If they ask you to goto the machine to pay for the stay, tell the staff your credit card has no pin. Then they will run it on the front desk for you.

This hotel was a great pick! Convenient to Kyobashi or Takaracho stations. The hotel opened April 1st so everything is clean and new. Small but not tiny, the room had 2 small chairs, flat screen tv, free use of cell phone, small bathroom with deep soaking tub, in room safe, and a mini fridge. No closet, and not much room to open 2 suitcases, but we were only staying 1 night, so it was adequate. They provide slippers and pajamas, as well as shampoo and body wash. Cold a.c. as well. We were pleasantly surprised by the complimentary evening ochazuke. Numerous toppings to put on rice, then pour hot dashi over. Delicious! I would recommend this place, and would stay again.
